title: Your First Java Project | DataStax Enterprise Recipes
description:
Full tutorial + resources: http://bit.ly/tutorials-recipes | A brief guide on how to Setup Your First Java Project on DataStax Enterprise. We have lots of helpful videos on DataStax Academy. Some cover big topics, like Apache Cassandra data modeling and some answer single questions like how do I install DataStax Enterprise. If our big course-long topics are "full course meals," these single question, DataStax Enterprise Recipes are "quick snacks."

ABOUT DATASTAX ENTERPRISE 5
DataStax Enterprise 5.0, the database platform for cloud applications, includes Apache Cassandra 3.x with materialized views, tiered storage and advanced replication. Introduced in 5.0 is DataStax Enterprise Graph, the first graph database fast enough to power customer-facing applications, scale to massive datasets and integrate advanced tools to power deep analytical queries.

Learn more at http://www.datastax.com/products/datastax-enterprise and https://academy.datastax.com/resources/whats-new-datastax-enterprise-50

CONNECT WITH DATASTAX
Subscribe: http://www.youtube.com/c/datastax?sub_confirmation=1 
Site: http://datastax.com 
Facebook: https://facebook.com/datastax 
Twitter: https://twitter.com/datastax 
Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/company/datastax
http://feeds.feedburner.com/datastax 
https://github.com/datastax 

ABOUT DATASTAX ACADEMY
On the DataStax Academy YouTube channel, you can find tutorials, webinars and much more to help you learn and stay updated with the latest information on DataStax EnterpriseÂ©.  Create an account on https://academy.datastax.com to watch our free online courses, tutorials, and more.

transcript.text: hi I'm Timberland and we are going to connect to data stacks enterprise with Java we've got a few recipes that tell you how to setup data stacks Enterprise locally once it's up and running you'll probably want to do something with it if you're a Java developer you'll want to use the Java driver to run this recipe you'll need three things installed get JDK 8 and DSC 4.8 or higher start by cloning this repository from github it's already setup with a build process and some scripts to help you get started run sequel shell from the project root directory that'll make it easier to run the cql script that sets up the schema and loads a little bit of sample data for you the example program is just a single class with a main method that exercises the data stacks Java driver a little bit you can edit the program any way you like but here I'm showing you the procedure for creating IntelliJ IDEA project files locally and opening it up in idea let's walk through the code a little bit before we run it the main method builds a cluster object telling it the address of a contact point in the cluster this is just the IP address of one of the cluster nodes and since it's a single node cluster that's easy enough to come up with then we specify the key space we want to connect to and we get a session object back this is the primary entry point for the whole API with the session object we can make prepared statements and directly execute queries and do more our main method is just going to insert a new record with a prepared statement then do a select and print out the results we can even go back into cql shell and verify using cql that it did the right thing of course in production Java code you don't put all your code in a main method you've got all kinds of options for how you organize your application but those are all beyond the scope of this recipe what we do have is a solid way to connect to Cassandra using Java
